Description: Rim and wall sherd of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery tripod bowl with top of leg; everted, flat-topped lip; white slip; interior and top of lip reserved; exterior: on lip, three narrow lines crossed by diagonal strokes; below, to left, two wide vertical black bands frame area of leg; between them row of three vertical rays above two short strips of maeander; most of decoration on right side of sherd lost, only traces of possible maeander remaining.
Curator's comments: The shape is rare, though one other fragment is known from Naukratis (Lemos 1991, 15).
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 243, no. 250)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.2047) (phase 2)
